fields.description:
h3. Environment
- Delegated LDAP Directory
- Implement any SSO with external authenticator

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Ensure you have a Delegated LDAP with Sync on Login configured.
- Login with a user,
- Validate the user's ADS groups are sync'ed on login into Jira as Expected.
- Implement any SSO: - EXTEND CLASS: public final class Jira44CasAuthenticator extends JiraSeraphAuthenticator # IMPLEMENT ANY SSO. (Edit seraph-config.xml - it must point to your new Class). 
- Add the user in another LDAP group  [^AtlassianSuppliedConfluenceCode.txt] 
- Login with the user.
- The user DOES NOT become member of the external group in JIRA -

h3. Expected Results
User should be added to the external groups when using SSO


h3. Actual Results
Users groups are not updated

h3. Notes
The same problem was happening in Confluence, it was addressed with a customised code as described in the issue: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24279
The code is attached to this issue
fields.summary: User is not added to groups when using delegated UD with external authenticator

fields.description:
While sharing the filters,  when the user click the drop down arrow to select the users they see Jira-Uses there.

If one select to share it with Jira-users then all the users are able to see the filter ( Also the one which is not related to their project).

The filter name might contains other customers information ( Name, Company Name, Company name with project name, etc) thereby compromising the privacy of other users.

However they are not able to access the issue from other project, using other's people filter but still they gets aware about the others companies / competitors.
fields.summary: Option to Remove Jira-Users from drop-down list while Sharing Filters.

fields.description:
h3. Summary:

The pie chart shows duplicate entries if you use a custom field as a statistic type with a multiple context containing the same of custom field options. 
 !context.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field *select list cascading (single option)* or *Select List (single choice)*
 # Configure custom field options
 # Add two or more context for this custom field withe the same custom field options
 # Associate this custom field to a screen
 # Create issues and add a value for this custom field
 # Go to the dashboard and add a gadget "pie chart"
 # Select a filter and use the custom field as the statistic type

h3. Expected Behaviour

No duplicate entries will be shown.
h3. Actual Behaviour

There are duplicate entries on the pie chart gadget probably because of the custom field context configured with the same custom field options. 
 !pie.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Pie Chart shows duplicate entries for a custom field with multiple Contexts

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Create a ticket and attach a file.
# Edit the description
# include the attachment in the description using Rich Editor "Attachment" button and save.
{code}[^filename.filetype]{code}
# The attachment will be added and has a hyperlink to it.
# Edit the Description and change to "Visual" tab where the attachment is hyperlinked.
# Copy the entire description and paste it into another ticket description that does not have the attachment.

h3. Expected Result:
JIRA will lose the render and back to the format below as there is no such attachment in the ticket
{code}[^filename.filetype]{code}

h3. Actual Result:
The string for the attachment will still be hyperlinked and save it will lose the Attachment rendering(hyperlink)

Then restart JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Summary
ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread is capable of entering a state where it is no longer checking messages. This can cause inconsistency between JIRA Data Center Nodes. 

h3. Environment
* JIRA Data Center

h3. Expected Results
* ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread always checks messages every three seconds. 

Expected stacktrace while waiting:

{noformat}
"ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread:thread-1" #109 prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007ff544016800 nid=0x7ee7 waiting on condition [0x00007ff508581000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: TIMED_WAITING (parking)
        at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
        - parking to wait for  <0x00000000d18db240> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject)
        at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.parkNanos(LockSupport.java:215)
        at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject.awaitNanos(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:2078)
        at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$DelayedWorkQueue.take(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:1093)
        at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$DelayedWorkQueue.take(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:809)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.getTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1067)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1127)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{noformat}

h3. Actual Results
* ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread enters a state where it no longer checks messages every three seconds. 
** Thread is no longer in TIMED_WAITING and is stuck in WAITING

Unexpected stacktrace. No longer checking messages:
* Affected threads would show this stacktrace and be stuck in this state without changing.

{noformat}
"ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread:thread-1" prio=5 tid=0x000000000000006c nid=0 waiting on condition 
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for <0x0000000020f2b558> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject.await(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:2039)
	at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$DelayedWorkQueue.take(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:1081)
	at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$DelayedWorkQueue.take(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:809)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.getTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1067)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1127)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
* Developer review "found that the ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread can go into WAITING state if any of the ClusterMessage consumers throw a Throwable exception."

h3.Workaround
* No workaround is available. 
* ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread that is no longer checking messages requires node to be restarted.
fields.summary: ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread can stop checking messages if Throwable is encountered

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA caches different data in *JiraAuthenticationContextImpl* and *RequestCacheController* for each request in ThreadLocal. That data is cleared after each request so there is no problem there, but during large issue export that data can stay around for a long time causing high memory pressure and later high GC pressure.

h3. Environment
 * JIRA instance with 1M+ issue

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access the issue navigator and search for large number of issues
 # Export these issues to Excel/CSV/XML

h3. Expected Results

Application streams the data and uses reasonable amount of memory (~100M)
h3. Actual Results

Application caches some data for the duration of the whole request. In some case it can be 2GB+ data, which might cause OOM
h3. Notes

Example of Dominator tree from heap dump after OOM
 !JVM_Heap_dom_tree.png|thumbnail!
h5. Objects details
 * Thread ajp-nio-8009-exec-819 - 5GB
{noformat}
Class Name                                                                                          | Shallow Heap | Retained Heap | Percentage
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread @ 0x132e509ba8  ajp-nio-8009-exec-819 Native Stack, Thread|          136 | 5,324,618,224 |     30.18%
|- java.lang.ThreadLocal$ThreadLocalMap @ 0x136e5f3528                                              |           24 | 5,213,775,632 |     29.55%
|  '- java.lang.ThreadLocal$ThreadLocalMap$Entry[2048] @ 0x14f984b088                               |        8,208 | 5,213,775,608 |     29.55%
|     |- java.lang.ThreadLocal$ThreadLocalMap$Entry @ 0x12b2acec98                                  |           32 | 2,967,537,480 |     16.82%
|     |- java.lang.ThreadLocal$ThreadLocalMap$Entry @ 0x12b2acec48                                  |           32 | 2,245,747,520 |     12.73%
|     |- java.lang.ThreadLocal$ThreadLocalMap$Entry @ 0x135da74120                                  |           32 |        83,272 |      0.00%
{noformat}
Note two large ThreadLocals: 2.9GB and 2.2GB
 requestUrl - {{/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-excel-all-fields/temp/SearchRequest.xls}} with empty _queryString_

h3. Workaround
Problem is largely mitigated by the following 
* _limiting search results export_, see JRASERVER-63239
* Limiting {{Custom Field Value}} cache, see JRASERVER-68806 
* Addition option to limit {{RequestCachingGroupManager}}, see JRASERVER-69733
fields.summary: JIRA uses excessive amount of memory during issue export

fields.description:
h3. Summary

At the moment, when we set SAML as the primary authenticator, Jira will redirect the users to the IDP login page but, it only happens when they access the page below:
{code}<JIRA Base URL>/login.jsp{code}
When we are in JIRA Dashboard page, CreateIssue page or any other page that is not *login.jsp*, the redirection would not happen and due to the SAML enabled, the Login gadget is missing to not allow users to log in from this page.

h3. Suggested Solution:
To have JIRA redirect users that are accessing JIRA Dashboard when they are not logging in yet will be great.

h3. Notes:
I can see that this could be a challenge as JIRA Dashboard Page is not just used for login, as we still access the same page after logging in with the gadgets.
{code}<JIRA BAse URL>/secure/Dashboard.jspa{code}

h3. Workaround
If you are sharing a one-click link for users to browse the dashboard, create issues or browse any other page in Jira, make sure the link goes to: 
*https://<BASE_URL>/login.jsp?os_destination=%2Fsecure%2FDashboard.jspa*
(i) Note that the URL above redirects to the dashboard.
fields.summary: SAML redirection from Jira Dashboard page or any page other than login.jsp

fields.description:
This would be helpful for a number of different fields.  However one example of this is in regards to trying to populate a Fix Version in the "Fix Version" field of  a new issue or an existing issue. In this case the list of Fix versions is long and complicated eg. 3.3.0.1.100, 3.3.0.1.101, 3.3.0.1.102. etc.

Ideally we would like to be able to simply enter the last three digits  i.e. 100, 101 etc in the "Fix Version" field of Jira so I can easily pick a particular version as opposed to typing the entire version name i.e. 3.3.0.1.100 

At the moment, the search results in the auto complete of this field do not allow those versions to be returned just by entering 102 or 101 etc for that field.
fields.summary: Allow auto complete for fields in Jira to populate search results based on end string of field option/value

fields.description:
As a JIRA search user, I would like to be able to use the {{CHANGED}} keyword on the {{issuetype}} field so that I can search for and get notified when someone changes an issue type from a Bug -> Task, Bug -> Feature, Feature -> Bug, etc...

Note: this is also mentioned in [my community question|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/CHANGED-keyword-on-issue-type/qaq-p/693828], where I was advised to create this suggestion. Thanks!
fields.summary: Add CHANGED keyword on 'issuetype'

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Following the steps in the [Importing and exporting issue workflows documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/importing-and-exporting-issue-workflows-844500778.html], some post functions are missing after importing to JIRA Server.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Export workflow from Cloud instance to .JWB.
# Import the workflow using the .JWB file to the Server Instance.


h3. Expected Results
 * Imported workflow will be exactly similar in terms of transitions, statuses, post functions, conditions, validators and triggers (except for functions derived from third-party addons).


h3. Actual Results
 * Some post functions are missing. Refer to screenshot below for example.
 !FromCloud.png|thumbnail!  vs  !Server.PNG|thumbnail! 
Missing post functions
# Set issue status to the linked status of the destination workflow step.
# Update change history for an issue and store the issue in the database.
# Fire a Generic Event event that can be processed by the listeners.
fields.summary: Importing Workflow from Cloud to Server are Missing Some Post Functions

fields.description: h2. Summary Words with some letters used in a group name or issue summary cause internal server error when searching for them using group picker or issue picker. h2. Environment * Jira Server - 7.5.3 or 6.3.10 or 7.6.2 (any version of Jira with group/issue picker) h2. Steps to reproduce # Go to Administration -> User Management # Add a group named "SİSTEM"  # Execute REST request http:///rest/api/2/groups/picker?query=STEM h2. Expected result A list of groups containing 'STEM' symbols are returned in JSON response. h2. Actual result The error message is returned {color:#ff0000}"{"errorMessages":["Internal server error"],"errors":{}}"{color} . The server log shows the following exception stack trace {code:java} Caused by: java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: 7 at java.lang.String.substring(String.java:1963) at com.atlassian.jira.util.DelimeterInserter.insert(DelimeterInserter.java:294) at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.issue.groups.GroupPickerResourceHelperImpl.buildMatchingHtml(GroupPickerResourceHelperImpl.java:146) at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.issue.groups.GroupPickerResourceHelperImpl.limitGroupResults(GroupPickerResourceHelperImpl.java:107) at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.issue.groups.GroupPickerResourceHelperImpl.findGroupsAsBean(GroupPickerResourceHelperImpl.java:93) {code} h2. Notes It will fail with the same error when you create an issue with Summary field having the last word with such symbols and try to search for it in an issue picker (e.g. when linking one issue to another). The problematic  method is *DelimeterInserter.insert(String targetString, String[] terms)* . When the length of the *targetString* when converted to lowercase is greater than the length of the original targetString the issue will appear. h2. Workaround A user can modify the problematic group name to add a regular word after the word with problematic symbol. But please note that in this case in the JSON response _html_ field will have slightly incorrect highlighting. For example if I have a group named *BİRİM group* and then query for *BİRİM* it will return the following: {code:java} {"header":"Showing 1 of 1 matching groups","total":1,"groups":[{"name":"BİRİM group","html":"BİRİM group"}]} {code} Please note that it highlights "BİRİM g" term instead of just BİRİM inside tags.
fields.summary: Group and issue picker functionality does not work for some letters

fields.description:
h3. Expected Behavior
Text will be selected with no major processing.

h3. Actual Behavior
There is _something_ going on with JavaScript functions that cause high CPU usage in browsers - so far, Chrome and Firefox.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable the "Rich text editor"
# In any field that uses the RTE, like Description or Comment, paste the following string:
{noformat:borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
(Testinginging TESTING Test T
{noformat}
# Try to select the text by moving the cursor to the beginning of the string and pressing Shift + ↓
# Observe that the page will get stuck for a little while, and JavaScript profiling will show the below function consuming 90%+ of processing time;
{noformat:borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-editor-plugin:tinymce/tinymce.js?batch=false
{noformat}

We haven't been able to detect a pattern on the string aside from the opening parenthesis, but we found it was easier when we had mixed case characters - likely because there are calls to {{toLowerCase()}} within the aforementioned function.

h3. Workaround
Avoid the use of the Rich Text Editor, or make sure to change back to the "Text" view when selecting text.
fields.summary: Selecting text after opening parenthesis using Jira's Rich Text Editor will result in high CPU usage on the browser

https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=285839562

This request is for the ability for Jira to re-generate a server ID when used for testing instances, perhaps when it detects a development license is in use
fields.summary: Change server ID on import for testing installations

fields.description:
Please see [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver074/managing-multiple-directories-881683376.html]
 The specific problem is near the bottom of this page where it cites Example #2
{quote}
h3. Updating Users and groups

If you update a user or group via the application's administration screens, the update will be made in the first directory where the application has write permissions.

Example 1:
 * You have connected two directories: The Customers directory and the Partners directory.
 * The application has permission to update both directories.
 * The Customers directory is first in the directory order.
 * A username {{jsmith}} exists in both the Customers directory and the Partners directory.
 * You update the email address of user {{jsmith}} via the application's administration screens.
 * The email address will be updated in the Customers directory only, not the Partners directory.

Example 2:
 * You have connected two directories: A read/write LDAP directory and the internal directory.
 * The LDAP directory is first in the directory order.
 * +All new users will be added to the LDAP directory. It is not possible to add a new user to the internal directory.+{quote}
 

I believe that the very last line is actually inaccurate now in all current versions of Jira Server.  You can in fact create a new user in either directory type in this configuration.   The document is indicating that this is not possible to create in the internal directory when in fact it is.

I suspect that this might have been true at the time this document was created.   I did come across this feature request that was implemented in Jira 5.0 https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-11322 to allow for managing accounts from different user directories.  I think this would have been necessary for the current functionality.  

I'm not sure though how to best address this issue, perhaps completely removing example #2 would be best here.   I still believe that Example #1 is still valid in Jira, but perhaps this would require a technical review to make sure this document is accurate for modern Jira versions.
fields.summary: Jira documentation on managing multiple user directories has inaccurate example

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA *Status* at Statuses page shows "No associated workflows", if you tried to *Delete* the status, you will get following error: _Given status is currently associated with a workflow(s) and cannot be deleted_ .
It's not clear if status is used or not. In this case status is used, but Statuses page shows incorrect data. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create status *status1* and associate with workflow _Workflow1_
# Edit workflow_Workflow1_ and remove status *status1*
#* (!) Normally this is not possible as JIRA would not allow removing statuses from active workflow 
# Don't safe the _Workflow1_ and keep the draft 
# Navigate to [ Admin > Issues > Statuses ] 
# Check status for *status1*

h3. Expected Results
Status has _1 associated workflow_

h3. Actual Results
No associated workflows
 
h3. Notes
* If you proceed with Delete, you will get following error: _Given status is currently associated with a workflow(s) and cannot be deleted_
* The problem is caused by chain of factors 
*# Initial _Workflow1_ had *status1* 
*# _Workflow1_ was edited and draft was not saved 
*#  The draft workflow doesn't have *status1*
*# During computation of workflows for statuses draft workflow is used, so JIRA couldn't detect the status. 

h3.Workaround
To fix the problem, please follow the steps below:
# Check status in workflows tables running the SQL query below:
{code}
select id,workflowname from jiraworkflows where descriptor like '%status1%';
select parentname from jiradraftworkflows where descriptor like '%status1%';
{code}
#* Take note on the workflow name from the output.
# Go to the workflow page and edit the workflow.
# Discard or publish the draft workflow and then we will see the status associated with the workflow.
fields.summary: JIRA Status is reported as "No associated workflows" while it's still used

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users are able to search for Groups with Special Characters using REST API and UI. To reproduce it properly you the following 3 conditions must be met:
# You should have a group with such tricky symbols in the database. 
# The last word in the group name must be the word with those symbols. For example it works fine for group *SİSTEM group* but fails for group named *My SİSTEM*
# For *Jira 6.3.10*, if you add the JVM parameter  -Dsun.jnu.encoding=Cp1252 and your query contain the tricky symbols from the group name, for example *?query=SISTEM* will work but *?query=SİSTEM* will fail (note the difference between İ and I). 

In the logs we see errors like:
{code}
Caused by: java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: 23
	at java.lang.String.substring(String.java:1963)
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.DelimeterInserter.insert(DelimeterInserter.java:294)
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.issue.groups.GroupPickerResourceHelperImpl.buildMatchingHtml(GroupPickerResourceHelperImpl.java:146)
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.issue.groups.GroupPickerResourceHelperImpl.limitGroupResults(GroupPickerResourceHelperImpl.java:107)
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.issue.groups.GroupPickerResourceHelperImpl.findGroupsAsBean(GroupPickerResourceHelperImpl.java:93)
	... 235 more
{code}

h3. Environment

Jira 7.5.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce

h5. Scenario 1: REST API

# Create a group *SİSTEM* and the following query fails all the time
{code:java}
<BASE_URL>/rest/api/2/groups/picker?query=SİSTEM
{code}

h5. Scenario 2: UI

# Create a group *SİSTEM* 
# Go to *Users and roles* page in any project
# Select *Add users to a role*
# Search for *SİSTEM*
# You will get the error:
{code}
The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation.
{code}

h3.Workaround
Modify the group names to add regular words at the end of the group name (e.g. 'group' word)
fields.summary: Not able to search for Groups with Special Characters using REST API and from the UI

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:
If we run an example of GET REST Call towards JIRA below, Issue Type field would not have Operation Items:
{code}
<JIRA Base URL>/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta?projectKeys=JRA&issuetypeNames=Bug&expand=projects.issuetypes.fields
{code}

h3. Expected Results
REST API docs mention the following (from https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/7.6.1)
{noformat}
"issuetypes": [
                {
                    "self": "http://www.example.com/jira/rest/api/2/issueType/1",
                    "id": "1",
                    "description": "An error in the code",
                    "iconUrl": "http://www.example.com/jira/images/icons/issuetypes/bug.png",
                    "name": "Bug",
                    "subtask": false,
                    "fields": {
                        "issuetype": {
                            "required": true,
                            "name": "Issue Type",
                            "hasDefaultValue": false,
                            "operations": [
                                "set"
                            ]
...
{noformat}

h3. Actual Results
Instead you get (result from JIRA - [createmeta|https://jira.atlassian.com/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta?projectKeys=JRA&issuetypeNames=Bug&expand=projects.issuetypes.fields] ): 
{code:JSON}
issuetypes: [
	{
		self: "https://jira.atlassian.com/rest/api/2/issuetype/1",
		id: "1",
		description: "A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.",
		iconUrl: "https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&avatarId=51493&avatarType=issuetype",
		name: "Bug",
		subtask: false,
		expand: "fields",
		fields: {
		...
			issuetype: {
				required: true,
				name: "Issue Type",
				hasDefaultValue: false,
				operations: [ ],
				allowedValues: [
{code}
Note that _operations_ is empty. 

h3. Suggested Solution
With the information in our documentation below, it is still possible to create an issue with setting the Issue Type using "Name" or "Id" but, since it is still possible, the opeartion items should mentioend "set" at least.
- [JIRA REST API Example - Create Issue|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-apis/about-the-jira-rest-apis/jira-rest-api-tutorials/jira-rest-api-example-create-issue]

Update the {{createMeta}} result for Issue Type to include "set"
fields.summary: Issue Type field missing operations items from the {{createmeta}} result.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In JIRA, the *Average Age Chart* gadget has a the field, *Project or Saved Filter*. This field has autosuggestion capabilities based on what has been typed so far. However, it is not possible to use the up/down arrow keys on the keyboard to navigate up and down the suggestion list. Trying to use the up/down arrow keys will cause the cursor to move to the beginning and end of the value typed into the field, rather than going through the list.

The following example gadget's do not exhibit similar behaviors, and the up/down arrow keys do allow for navigating through the autosuggestion lists:
* Two Dimensional Filter Statistics - Saved Filter
* Filter Results - Saved Filter 
* Issue Statistics - Project or Saved Filter

Ideally, the *Average Age Chart* behaves like the above examples for consistency.

h3. Environment
* Reproducible in JIRA 7.5.0 and JIRA 7.6.0
* Reproducible in both versions of JIRA above, in Chrome, Firefox, and Safari (not tested in IE/Edge)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add the *Average Age Chart* gadget to a dashboard
# (Optional) Begin typing some value into the *Project or Saved Filter* field such that there are suggested results
# Attempt to scroll through the suggested results using the up/down arrow keys

h3. Expected Results

The up/down arrow keys navigate through the suggestions so that the enter key may be used to select a value.

h3. Actual Results

The up/down arrow keys move the text cursor to the beginning and end of any value typed into the field.
 
h3. Notes
This appears to be a regression of sorts of [JRASERVER-18724 : Autocomplete keyboard navigation does not work in Internet Explorer|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-18724].

h3.Workaround

Use a mouse's scroll wheel to scroll, and click the value desired from the suggestion list.
fields.summary: Average Age Chart gadget project and filter selection cannot be scrolled with keyboard arrow keys

fields.description:
Import From CSV imports time but truncates anything smaller than the hour mark. Where as the CSV import (Admin function) works just fine.

 

 
||From Edgar||
|When I use the "import from csv" option from Issues menu, I have a problems in the Original Estimate field, because if the time I want to import is less than an hour (for example 0.5 hours or 1800 seconds) the result value in the Original Estimate field is 0. However this does not happen if I import using "CSV Import" option available in System menu (the one available for Jira Admins). It works fine converting the 1800 seconds to 30 minutes in the Original Estimate field. Could you make the same behavior for csv import option from Issues menu?. Thanks.
 
 

Effort (CSV file Column) Original Estimate (Jira field)
1800 0
1800 seconds should be equal to 30 minutes in the Original Estimate field of the created ticket, but instead the result I am getting is 0.
However if I use the "import from CSV" available from System menu (the one available only for Jira Admins), I get the following after importing:
Effort (CSV file Column) Original Estimate (Jira field)
1800 30 minutes
That is the results Jira users want, but they cannot use the import option from Sytem menu as they are not Jira Admins. They can only access the one in Issues menu, but this one does not work well when the value to be imported is less than 1 hour.|
fields.summary: Import From CSV And CSV Import Handle Time Different

fields.description:
JQL does not appear to short-circuit evaluation which causes more issues to be considered than necessary. We recently noticed how impactful this is using "was" because it queries the database and not the index. Consider:

project = ABC AND status was Resolved

In our observation this seems to evaluate to all resolved issues in the entire instance, not just those in project ABC. JQL would evaluate much faster if it took the result of each clause and reduced the scope of issues that the next clause was evaluated against.
fields.summary: Short-circuit JQL evaluation

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*
 At the moment, in our  [documentation here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver072/visual-editing-838542506.html], it says,

??In Visual mode, you can still enter wiki markdown syntax as you add your content, and it'll be rendered exactly as it'll display when you save.??

Which means that it will still render the syntax the way wiki markup renders it. In some cases, the users would need visual mode to simply show the strings exactly as users type it (without following how wiki markup renders it). For example, if the customer type \ followed by _, it will treat it as escape character and remove \ instead, while this is being used to identify directory and it's important to keep \. 

 

*Suggested Solution*
 It would be great to have the option to allow visual mode to escape wiki markup rendering, and let the user get what they see/type.

h3. Problem Definition

The following documents seem to be only for IIS 7.x and the earlier version.

* [Integrating JIRA applications with IIS|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/integrating-jira-applications-with-iis-938847749.html]
* [Integrating JIRA applications with IIS using ARR|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/integrating-jira-applications-with-iis-using-arr-313467089.html]

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be better if there were the document for the latest IIS (IIS 10.x).
fields.summary: Documentation about IIS integration

fields.description:
h3. +Issue description+

There can be some situation where a component is created with an empty lead (especially while using a 3rd party add-on).
 In this case, if an XML backup is created and used to perform a project import, the project import will fail with the following error:
{code:java}
There are '1' required user(s) that JIRA can not automatically create.
{code}
h3. +Suggested solution to fix this behavior+

The suggestion would be to:
 - either add a constraint to the component table in the database to prevent the lead column from being empty.
 - or modify the ProjectComponentManager.create() to stop the creation of the component if the lead field is empty (OR if the lead field is empty, replace this field with a null field)
fields.summary: Add a constraint to the component table in the database to prevent the lead column from being empty

fields.description:
When a User Picker custom field is added to the permission scheme, specifically to the _Browse Projects_ permission, if the _Context_ of the custom field is set as Global, it will it will give visibility of the project to ALL users with access to JIRA (even though they cannot see the issues, they are able to see the project). This can cause confusion and in a worst case, legal issues. 

For clarity, the behavior I describe happens with the following scenario:
# Create a User
# Create a Project.
# Remove everyone from the Browse project permission scheme.
# Create a User Picker (multiple users) type custom field.
# Edit permissions scheme of the new project, adding the new User Picker custom field to the _Browse Projects_ permission.
# Login as the new user — The new project will be visible in the list of projects, even though the user is not included in the custom field in any issue of the project. (Actually, ALL users get visibility of the project).

It is possible to prevent this behavior by setting the context of the custom field to Project-based instead of Global (even if you select all projects), but it is counter-intuitive that adding a custom field to a permission will cause this behavior, and having to include manually project by project to the context of custom fields can easily lead to administration issues, so the suggestion is that this behavior should simply never occur; the only reason for a user to have visibility of a project is that they are actually matching the criteria of the Browse project permission.
fields.summary: Project visible due to a Custom field in the Permission scheme

fields.description: The printable searchrequest issue resource in Atlassian Jira before version 7.2.12 and from version 7.3.0 before 7.6.1 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTML or JavaScript via a cross site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the jqlQuery query parameter.

fields.description:
h3. It is not possible to remove a fix version from an issue once that fix version is archived (this is still true in JIRA v7.5.3).
h3. Already in 2005 this behaviour was reported as a bug, see --JRASERVER-6419--, but it was resolved as "works as designed".
h3. Now in 2017 people still do not understand why it was 'designed' this way, again see the comments on --JRASERVER-6419--. Hence this feature request.
fields.summary: Ability to remove an archived fix version from an issue

fields.description:
We have been warned from BTMU for critical Apache strut vulnerability (CVE-2017-9805, CVE-2017-9804, CVE-2017-9805 ). 
As you are aware of "Apache Struts Critical Vulnerability", All Servers with Apache Struts 2.3.x or 2.5.x. have to be patched along with Bank Policy (Critical Patch) to minimize impact of Cyber attack via vulnerabilities. Apache Struts 2 is an open-source web application framework for developing Java EE web applications. It uses and extends the Java Servlet API to encourage developers to adopt a model–view–controller (MVC) architecture. This vulnerability can let attacker to perform remote code execution attack when using REST plugin (CVE-2017-9805). From September 9, 2017


Currently we using product Jira version 7.1.4 this version found apache struts version 2.3.20


We need advice and how to fix it. Or, If all issues is not vulnerable to current struts issue please confirm.
fields.summary: Apache Struts Critical Vulnerability

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When performing group management functions in JIRA, system performance slows and the number of database connections in the pool grows beyond the maximum number configured in the dbconfig.xml and will not recover without a system restart.  

h3. Environment
*  JIRA connected to a Crowd instance
* 300,000+ distinct user groups managed in Crowd, but synched into JIRA.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect JIRA to a Crowd instance that contains 300,000 groups
# Synchronize
# Perform any group management function in JIRA (for example, search for a group name in the Project roles section, add a user to a group via the user profile page, etc)

h3. Expected Results
JIRA's database connection pool will stay within defined limits as per the <pool-max-size> element.

h3. Actual Results
JIRA's database connections rapidly exceed the defined limits and will not recover without a restart.  
 
h3.Workaround
Limit the number of user groups synchronized into JIRA as per [User management limitations and recommendations|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/user-management-limitations-and-recommendations-828787689.html].
fields.summary: Jira leaks database connections during group management functions with high number of user groups.

fields.description:
As a tester / developer / business analyst / customer

I want to see which area is the most "infected" (where are the most of the bugs)

And I want to get rid of duplicate bugs

And i want to see bugs connected to their stories

And I want to see stories grouped together by their subject to follow changes easily

 

So please implement Natural Language Processing to group / cluster issues based on their title, type, description, labels and comments. 

This would also improve issue search itself (filtering)

Most of the multinational companies use Jira in English, so English IT dictionaries and/or existing Jiras would be good as teaching data.

 

This would be a major improvement, so may be an extra service for some additional fee paid.
fields.summary: Implement Natural Language Processing to group / cluster issues

fields.description:
As a sys admin, we have our OpenLDAP for authentication, and all password are stored using SSHA512 encryption (type designator {CRYPT}$6$).

In Jira, when the users update their passwords, it is storing the password in DES (type designator {CRYPT}).

As a admin I would like to have the passwords stored using SSHA512 in Jira.
fields.summary: Use SSHA512 for user passwords cryptography

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Whenever a license that is not of type Atlassian stack is being applied to a Jira product, the Atlassian stack licenses for the other Jira products is removed.
h3. Expected Behavior

It should be possible to use a standalone license for any of the Jira applications when a higher user tier than Stack provides is necessary.
h3. Actual Behavior

The Atlassian Stack license is removed from Jira if any of the applications are activated using a standalone license.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup a Jira installation using an Atlassian Stack license;
 # In *Administration > Applications > Versions and licenses*, update the license of Jira Service Desk to an evaluation one;
 # Refresh the page;
 # Note that the Stack license that activated Jira Core and Jira Software is removed;

h3. Workaround

There is no known workaround that allows for the Stack license to be used together with a non-Stack license
 * *Customers who have purchased Atlassian Stack + a higher tier (such as 1000 JSD agents) should contact support for assistance with the license. Reference this bug when contacting support.*
fields.summary: Atlassian Stack license is removed upon activation of another license for any Jira application

fields.description:
h3. Summary

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Click Create Issue button
# Upload 3 to 4 attachment files.
# Click attachment button ( !browse-attachment-button.png! ) and select the images.

!example.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results.

!expected-behaviour.png|thumbnail!

!create-issue-form.png|thumbnail!

!example.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

h3. Notes

* Prior JIRA 7.3 version doesn't have the problem

fields.description:
If issues are shared with external users, it is quite often confusing for them that they cant easily answer this e-mail since its sent by Jira and not by the person sharing the issue.

I suggest to make it easier to answer on shared e-mails. I have the following ideas for possible solutions:
 * Adding the sharing users e-mail to the sent notification with some information: "This Jira issue was shared with you from " insert USER XXX". If you want to answer via e-mail, please reply to "insert E-MAIL-ADDRESS FROM USER XXX".
 * Adding the sharing users e-mail as the sending e-mail.
 * Add a HTML button to the e-mail which leads to "mailto:E-MAIL-ADDRESS FROM USER XXX"
fields.summary: Issue sharing: User sharing the issues e-mail-address should be included in sent e-mail

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:
At the moment, JIRA is allowing the creation of users without a password and it will generate a random password for the user:
bq. If you do not enter a password, one will be generated automatically.
There is an option to send an email to the Created User Email Address where the user will be asked to set up their password.

But, this seems to lead multiple problems where it is not required to create a password when creating a user such as:
# When it is Randomly generated, we won't know what the password is if the option to send mail notification is not set.
# With the option to send notification is not selected by default, it is possible that the Admin forgot to select it leads to a random password generated for the user.
# As the created user without password is not asked to set up the password when logging in, they can only reset the password through the email or ask the admin after a lot of retries with the error "Wrong Username and Password" showing rather than "Please Reset Your Password to log in"
# The admin will require resetting their password when the user is complaining that they unable to log in without knowing that the password was randomly generated before.

h3. Suggested Solution:
For the problem above, suggested solution that I could provide for the user that the password was randomly generated:
* When the admin is not providing a password when creating a user, the "Notification" feature will be automatically triggered.
* Allow those users to set up the password when they try to log in for the first time if their email notification is not selected.
* Give the warning "Please reset your password to log in" when they try to log in.
* Or password shouldn't be generated at all.

In addition, a documentation update of ["Create, edit, or remove a user"|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/create-edit-or-remove-a-user-938847025.html] for this will be great as well.

h3. Notes:
* This would not apply for Internal with LDAP Authentication or Delegated directory as JIRA will use the password from the External Directory instead.
fields.summary: Problem in creating user without password.

fields.description:
I would like to draw your attention to the following issue:

 When we finish task we set "Remaining Estimate" to 0.

However if after that we book time on the same task the new "Log Work" plugin calculates "Remaining Estimate" as  "Original Estimate" - SUM("Booked time"), which in some cases is not 0



You can reproduce the issue described with the next steps:

 
 # Task with Original Estimate exists (e.g. Original estimate = 24h),
 # Log any time for this task, e.g. 2h 25m
 # Close task and clear the Remaining estimate manually to 0h
 # Report your time via 'My Work' view -> select the mentioned task -> set Time Spent, e.g. 10 min

Issue: Remaining Estimate is automatically set to Original Estimate - time spent - newly reported time spent. The fact that remaining time was manually cleared is not taken into account.
fields.summary: Issue with Remaining estimate field in Work Time Calendar Plugin

h3. Other Notes
 * Problem *DOES NOT* happen in JIRA 7.3.0 and 7.4.2.
 * Problem tested and reproducible on JIRA 7.5.2, 7.5.3, 7.6.0

h3. Workaround
 *  Assign issue from issue sidebar instead of Assign button.
fields.summary: Not able to assign users if the current assigned user loses "browse projects permission" after assigning to another user

fields.description:
h3. Summary

'Drag n Drop' for issues should not work in Issue Navigator list view. It should only work for rearranging subtask in issue view.
h3. Environment

JIRA 7.6.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to Issue > Search issue > Issue Navigator list view
 # Drag and Drop any issue to rearrange it.
 # Refresh the page. It does not has any effect on issue navigator.

h3. Expected Results

Drag and drop should not work in Issue Navigator.
h3. Actual Results

Rearranging issues in issue navigator works but does not have any effect.
 !drag and drop bug 7.6.png|thumbnail! 
  
h3. Notes

Drag and Drop subtask feature was introduced in JIRA 7.6.0.
h3. Workaround

It is possible to disable the dragging of subtask through the use of a dark feature.  
 # Login to Jira as an administrator
 # Navigate to $JIRAbaseURL /secure/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa
 # add the value of  *{color:#333333}com.atlassian.jira.issuetable.draggable.disabled{color}* to the enable dark feature and click Add

However this will prevent the dragging of these subtasks both on the issue details page and through the issue navigator.  Note:  In the issue details view you will still see the up and down arrows that can be used to rearrange the order of these subtasks.
fields.summary: 'Drag n Drop' for issues should not work in Issue navigator list view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Under rare circumstances Jira can recover from an OutOfMemoryError as experienced in some our support cases. In general after {{java.lang.OutOfMemoryError}}, the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) will likely be in an unstable state and hence it is essential to restart your JIRA applications immediately.

h3. Suggested Solution
This request is for Jira to notify administrators in some fashion after restarting from an out of memory error that an out of memory error has occurred and what information to provide Atlassian for root cause analysis ( heap dump, core dump,. etc )

h3. Workaround 
[JDK 8 update 92|https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8152669] and later provide startup flags that will cause the application to crash after an out of memory error:
{quote}Two new JVM flags have been added:
 * ExitOnOutOfMemoryError
 ** When you enable this option, the JVM exits on the first occurrence of an out-of-memory error. It can be used if you prefer restarting an instance of the JVM rather than handling out of memory errors.

 * CrashOnOutOfMemoryError
 ** If this option is enabled, when an out-of-memory error occurs, the JVM crashes and produces text and binary crash files (if core files are enabled).{quote}

Add following option into *JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARGS* in {{setenv.sh}}:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
-XX:+ExitOnOutOfMemoryError
{code}
fields.summary: As a Jira administrator I would like to be notified when an out of memory occurs

This way I wouldn't need to create a filter or select each status I want, one by one.

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, JIRA will display the username and avatar of the user who logged work time in each issue page. 

Due to the European privacy law, European customer will have to prevent the detail of the user who logged work time from being shown in the log work tab.


h3. Suggested Solution

Add option in JIRA to allow JIRA Administrator to hide the user detail in the Log Work tab. The information that should be hidden are:

# Username
# Avatar

None

Do you have on your Jira roadmap feature like issue teplating? Among dev teams we have few Ops teams and for them templating issue will be really valuable feature.

Something like "Issue Templates for Jira by InTENSO IT Experts" from marketplace (unfortunately our company policy  limits the purchase of additional plugins)

fields.description:
I like many developers may look up a Jira issue in the morning, then go off and do my real work in IntelliJ, then several hours later go back and try to update the page with what I did. If it's past the timeout, the web page provides no indication that the session has been dropped, and the "comment" and other features work normally. So what sometimes ends up happening is that I spend 10-15 minutes writing a detailed update of what I did, then press "add" and the progress indicator shows that it's working, but it's really not. Then if anything happens,or I get taken back to a login page, then my 15 minutes of work disappears. There are few things more aggravating in this world than having to do what you just did all over again for no good reason. 

It is a workflow killer to have this setting anything less than an entire work day, as it is unreasonable to expect the developers that randomly go in and out of Jira, Fisheye, Confluence, Bamboo to remember which tool is close to session timeout when you get back to it. Though I am trying to get in the habit of doing a Ctrl+c on the complete text before I submit anything because web form submissions).

If the page could prompt telling us we are being logged out in so many minutes, or display a box that tells us our session has expired even that would be great.

Thanks in advance!
fields.summary: Improved Client Session Awareness

fields.description:
Corresponding Confluence Server suggestion: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-54434

Add a toggle in administration to underline hyperlinks. You've made a decision not to underline hyperlinks by default but requiring CSS modification is unnecessary and deters organizations from making pages accessible.

Every single set of web accessibility guidelines including WCAG 2.0 calls for underlined links. One of the many accessibility reasons to underline links is that many users can't differentiate certain colors (and JIRA's link color is very close to its text color). You should reverse the design decision but if you will not I think you should at least include a toggle as an accessibility feature.
fields.summary: Toggle to Underline Hyperlinks for Accessibility

fields.description:
Hello,

 

One feature that I miss very much in Jira is to be able to collapse and expand comments. This ability would need to be available on an individual level and has to be persistent (i.e. kept track of between sessions).

 

The reason this is important to me is that it would save me time to not have to re-read inane, irrelevant comments like "I'm taking over this ticket." or "When will the fix be ready?".

 

Thanks,

Finn
fields.summary: Ability to hide/show comments persistently

fields.description:
Hi,

          One of our customers is facing the following issue. After upgrading their instance from 6.4 to 7.5 (several upgrade steps were made, to the 6.4.14 point release to 7.0 and so on). when you click on Assign on the issue view it takes a lot of time until the popup window shows up. Additionally, if you click on the arrow to display the list of users it takes forever and normally the operation timeouts. This behavior wasn't present when the instance was on version 6.4, with the same amount of users, and the assign popup and  user list response was very quick.

 

The platform has more than 90.000 users in both an internal and an LDAP delegated directories, having 90% of the users on the internal directory. Most of the users are reporters and they dont have the Assignable user permission on any project. Because it seems like an user related issue, i deactivated most of the users via an sql script on a test environment (that is an actual clone of the production VM). After this massive deactivation, the dialog and user list are displayed normally with almost quick response times.

 

can this be related to the change on the database driver on 7.4? is there a way to optimize any database parameter on our database engine in order to get a better response (we use MSSQL)? I asume Jira has to make an assignable user filter checking all the active users against the permission schemes, and this is quicker on a smaller user base, but the strange thing is that on earlier versions it could handle it better. We have a dozen of projects, each one have its own permission scheme. Could the performance be improved  changing the several group based schemes to a single role based scheme shared by all the projects and make the group/role association on each project?

Any suggestion would be very appreciated,

 

Thanks!

PS: I had to create this as a suggestion because if a chose Support request it showed me a screen without proper fields to complete.

 

Our client is Aquanima (Iberica de Compras) and its SEN is: SEN-1434993

Best Regards 

 

Pablo da Silva
fields.summary: Slower response on the assignee dialog after upgrading from 6.4.X  to 7.5.0

When you open a linked issue (from the respective panel on Issue View screen), the up/down arrow keys stop working until you regain focus on the page.
h3. Environment

Jira Software 7.3.3 and 7.5.0.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the full page of an issue that has issue links.(Note that the up/down arrow keys are working on scrolling the page)
 # Open an issue from the linked issues panel.

h3. Expected Results

Up/Down arrow keys still scroll the page up and down.
h3. Actual Results

The up/down arrow keys stop working until clicking on the page to gain focus.
h3. Workaround

Clicking on the issue page again or using the right arrow key to regain focus on the page.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

More often than not, there will be a need to share large-sized data between JIRA users in the issues but there is limit to how big the file can be attached. The default is 10485760 bytes (10 MB). The maximum attachment size is 2147483647 bytes (2 GB).

h3. Suggested Solution

Release a commercial version of Atlassian Transfer (https://transfer.atlassian.io/) which is a  file-uploader microservice that can be integrated with Atlassian products such as JIRA for users to conveniently upload large-sized attachments into the issues.
fields.summary: Release a commercial version of Atlassian Transfers

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:
Looking at the version of Mantis that is supported for plugin seems to be really old and this is specifically MySQL
- [Importing data from Mantis|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/importing-data-from-mantis-938847610.html]
bq. JIRA Importers plugin is compatible with Mantis versions 1.1.8 to 1.2.16.

If we go through the documentation for Mantis itself, the mentions 1.2.x it supports for MySQL 5.0.x differ with JIRA which is already 5.6.
- https://www.mantisbt.org/docs/master-1.2.x/en/administration_guide.pdf

This appears to affect the plugin that uses {{default_storage_engine}} that is available for MySQL recent release while 5.0.x is still using {{storage_engine}}. The import will fail as JIM will use {{default_storage_engine}} when trying to connect to Mantis database.
{code}
jdbc:mysql://<MySQL URL>/mantis\_db?useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=UTF8&sessionVariables=default_storage_engine=InnoDB&autoReconnect=true&useUnicode=true&zeroDateTimeBehavior=convertToNull&useCursorFetch=true&defaultFetchSize=100
{code}

h3. Suggested Solution:
To update the supported Mantis version accordingly.

h3. Notes:
* This is detected when using JIRA 7.6 that has JIRA Importer Plugin 8.0.1
* The same issue not happening using JIRA 7.0 that uses JIRA Importer Plugin 7.0
* The "mysql-connector-java-5.1.46 driver" could be used as a workaround as some customer reported that it works. But, it does not always work.
fields.summary: JIRA Importer Plugin Suppoerted Mantis Documentation Update

fields.description:
Currently, it's possible to make Epic Link a required field by unlocking the field via SQL query, as described here: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-unlock-a-locked-field-779158866.html|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-unlock-a-locked-field-779158866.html.], and then clicking the Required link in the field configuration. However, any subsequent upgrade of the Jira software will switch it back to being optional again.

The recommended approach from Atlassian for making Epic Link required is to do so via a workflow validation rule. However, this is less than optimal for two reasons:
 # Default behavior in Jira is that each project gets its own workflow, meaning that each of potentially dozens to hundreds of workflows must be modified to add a validator. By contrast, projects default to using a single field configuration, so there are usually very few of these to modify to make a field required in the conventional way.
 # Fields made required via workflow validator do not appear as required (red asterisk) when viewing the form, so users do not have the right expectations until they receive an error on submitting it.

My suggestion is to allow Epic Link to be made required like any other field, persisting across Jira software updates, and ideally without requiring direct SQL queries to unlock it first.
fields.summary: Allow Epic Link to be made required

fields.description:
*Please note: This behavior is also experienced when using markdown to create an attachment. In that using markdown in text mode to create the attachment inclusion, switching to "visual" mode and editing the text within the markdown, and then switching back to "visual" mode will cause the name of the attachment in the markdown to be removed.*

 

*Summary*

When a user:
 * Creates two external links in text mode
 * Changes back to visual mode and makes an edit
 * Changes back to edit mode

The second link URL will be erased, leaving it as plain text instead of a hyperlink.

 *Environment*
 * Reported by user in 7.3.4.

 * Confirmed by support in 7.6 w/ pgsql 9.4

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Within a comment, choose text mode and create two links
 # switch to visual mode and add a letter to the title of the first link
 # switch to text mode and observe the second link is removed

Video of issue is attached.
h3.  *Expected Results*

Link is edited by user in either mode and no links are removed.
h3. *Actual Results*

URL is removed from second link.
h3. *Workaround*

Use either the Visual or Text modes exclusively when working with links.
fields.summary: Editing links or other markdown in comment section using "Visual" tab breaks link in "Text" tab

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira default workflow generates corrupted descriptor for Software Project.

h3. Environment
 * JIRA Software 7.6.0-EAP01
 * JIRA Agile 6.7.16

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Software Project (Any of Scrum, Kanban, Basic)
 # Edit its workflow and select Post Functions
 !Screenshot 2017-12-07 18.10.18.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

Transitions are correctly rendered.
h3. Actual Results

Transitions get corrupted. However, no error or warning occur. This corruption also happens to copied workflow from the original generated one.
h3. Notes

Descriptor is formatted by valid XML. However, it contains redundant line break in XML attributes like:
{code:none}
<arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.event.FireIssueEventFunction
              </arg>
{code}
E.g. Here's a whole record: [^1512632770_workflow.csv] from
{code:none}
select * from jiraworkflows where workflowname id = 10200
{code}
It's still not sure which is the problem injecting line break itself or parser unavailability for a line break.
h3. Workaround

For Jira administrator:
 * If you need to edit the generated workflow, create your own workflow instead of editing or copying the generated workflow

For system administrator:
 # [Stop JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/start-and-stop-jira-applications-938847802.html]
 # Make sure to [backup data|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/backing-up-data-938847673.html] just in case
 # Fix the descriptor
 ** For instance:
{code:none}
$ W_ID="10200"
$ psql ... -d __DB_NAME__ -c "Copy (select descriptor from jiraworkflows where id = ${W_ID}) To STDOUT;" > descriptor_${W_ID}.xml
# Edit the xml file (Remove '\n' and the redundant line breaks)
$ psql ... -c "update jiraworkflows set descriptor = '$(cat descriptor_${W_ID}.xml)' where id = ${W_ID}" __DB_NAME__
{code}
 # [Start JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/start-and-stop-jira-applications-938847802.html]
 # Verify the affected workflow is fixed (Discard the draft workflow if exists)
fields.summary: XML descriptor gets broken with Software Project

fields.description:
In languages like spanish, there are special characters which are considered equivalents to the 'regular' roman alphabet letters ( *é* is still considered an *e*, etc).
 The main issue with this is search does not consider these characters equivalent and thus trying to search for usernames with tild or e-accute, like René using 'Rene' (without the tilde) does not get results. This is kind of counter intuitive as by today's standards, this kind of flexibility in search functions is standard.

The suggestion is to include the capability for JIRA search to recognize these special characters as the equivalents that they are. This article also give some more insight into this topic:[https://simple.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roman_alphabet]
fields.summary: Improve search (issues, text, users) to recognize special characters that are equivalent to the regular roman alphabet.

fields.description: The Atlassian Home notifications is an exceptionally helpful tool for managing issues in JIRA and Confluence that needs attention. Because many workflows in JIRA center around using a Dashboard as a one-stop-shop for knowing what tasks are needing attention, it would help to streamline workflows if we could extend the Atlassian Home Notifications to JIRA in the form of a Gadget.
fields.summary: Create a Home Notifications Gadget for JIRA Boards

fields.description:

But nowhere on the page did it show him what project  he was about to Delete!  Pressing the back button took him to the Project Settings page. That didn't have it either. The project name wasn't even in the URL!

Please consider adding the project name as a suffix to the Project Settings and Delete Project banners. If you have to put up a warning, it should be absolutely clear no questions asked what they are about to do.
fields.summary: Project settings, delete project page should show project name

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When they expire and users attempt to log in to Confluence or Jira they are not redirected to the Crowd Console.

It also appears that users are not able to reset their expired passwords but have to use the "Forgot Password" link. 

A problem with this is some users do not have access to their email with crowd working since it uses Crowd for authentication.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Have Jira configured to a Crowd user directory
# Connect to crowd with admin privileges
# Set the attribute {{requiresPasswordChange}} to {{true}} for a test user ( Example, usertest )
# Synchronize Jira with Crowd
# Connect to Jira as usertest

h3. Expected Results
User should be able to change his password from Jira.

h3. Actual results
# Unable to login. The following message is displayed : "Sorry, your username and/or password are incorrect. Please try again"
# usertest need to change their password from Crowd


h3. Workaround
Ask you Crowd administrator to update the password at Crowd side.
_OR_
Set the attribute {{requiresPasswordChange}} to {{true}} and then ask the user to access the following Crowd URL to change the password:
